update.description:
Various`Destroy*` functions in Scene have been extended to include an optional arg that lets user destroy nodes recursively. By default it’s false.

Note the difference between `Remove*` and `Destroy*`.  ‘Remove' detaches the node from the tree while ’Destroy' deletes the node \(and detaches its children if recursive is set to false\)
update.title: Add functions to recursively destroy a node and its children

pull_request.title: Add functions to recursively destroy a node and its children

pullrequest.title: Add functions to recursively destroy a node and its children

content.raw: I think there is potential for an infinite recursion here if there is a cycle in the graph. Consider `parent->AddChild(child)` was called and `child==parent` by accident. Not sure if this is the right place to fix it though. It would make sense if `Node::AddChild` checked if the child points to itself before adding.
content.html: I think there is potential for an infinite recursion here if there is a cycle in the graph. Consider parent->AddChild(child) was called and child==parent by accident. Not sure if this is the right place to fix it though. It would make sense if Node::AddChild checked if the child points to itself before adding.
